Key Arguments: The legislation will damage free speech, which is a non-negotiable human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' as causing harm, including psychological harm, is subjective and cannot be effectively policed by the government.
Australians have experienced increasing restrictions on speech in recent years, and this bill represents an extreme version of those restrictions.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded.
It is simply not possible for governments to police such subjectivity.
